info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 12 at 12:14AM MDT until June 12 at 12:45AM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 AM MDT FOR NORTHEASTERN HARDING AND CENTRAL UNION COUNTIES... At 1214 AM MDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 17 miles south of Mount Dora, or 21 miles southwest of Clayton, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Mount Dora. This includes Highway 64 between Mile Markers 411 and 419. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
